form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Hatch (for himself, Mr. Whitehouse, Mr. Alexander, and Mr. Corker) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 17, United States Code, to ensure fairness in the establishment of certain rates and fees under sections 114 and 115 of such title, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Songwriter Equity Act of 2015.

section.header: Effect on royalties for underlying works
section.text: Section 114(i) of title 17, United States Code, is amended to read as follows:

subsection.header: Effect on royalties for underlying works
subsection.text: It is the intent of Congress that royalties payable to copyright owners of musical works for the public performance of their works shall not be diminished in any respect as a result of the rights granted in section 106(6).

section.header: Application to sections 112(e) and 114(f) sound recording proceedings

subsection.text: Neither section 2 of this Act nor the amendment made to section 114(i) of title 17, United States Code, by such section 2 shall be taken into account in any proceeding to set or adjust the rates and fees payable for the use of sound recordings under section 112(e) or section 114(f) of such title that is pending on, or commenced on or after, the date of the enactment of this Act.

Neither section 2 of this Act nor the amendment made to section 114(i) of title 17, United States Code, by such section 2 shall have any effect upon the decisions, or the precedents established or relied upon, in any proceeding to set or adjust the rates and fees payable for the use of sound recordings under section 112(e) or section 114(f) of such title before the date of the enactment of this Act.

Section 801(b)(1) of title 17, United States Code, is amended by striking The rates applicable under sections 114(f)(1)(B), 115, and 116 shall be calculated to achieve the following objectives and inserting The rates applicable under sections 114(f)(1)(B) and 116 shall be calculated to achieve the following objectives.
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to any proceeding that is pending on, or commenced on or after, the date of the enactment of this Act.

Section 115(c)(3)(D) of title 17, United States Code, is amended by striking In addition to the objectives set forth in section 801(b)(1), in establishing such rates and terms, the Copyright Royalty Judges may consider rates and terms under voluntary license agreements described in subparagraphs (B) and (C). and inserting the following: The Copyright Royalty Judges shall establish rates and terms that most clearly represent the rates and terms that would have been negotiated in the marketplace between a willing buyer and a willing seller. In establishing such rates and terms, the Copyright Royalty Judges shall base their decision on marketplace, economic, and use information presented by the participants. In establishing such rates and terms, the Copyright Royalty Judges may consider the rates and terms for comparable uses and comparable circumstances under voluntary license agreements..
The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply to any proceeding that is pending on, or commenced on or after, the date of the enactment of this Act.
